actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on March 3, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House resumed Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification of the continuation of the national emergency with respect to Ukraine
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-14).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification of the continuation of the national emergency with respect to Venezuela
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-13).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification of the continuation of the national emergency with respect to Zimbabwe
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-12).
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Mr. James asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Wednesday, March 1, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on Friday, March, 3, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 272

actions-list.actionItem: The House adopted the amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 347.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Roy amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 199
On agreeing to the Lee (NV) amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 364
actions-list.actionItem: 56 (Roll no. 129).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 187
On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 181
On agreeing to the Boebert amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 386
actions-list.actionItem: 31 (Roll no. 126).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Bost amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 324
actions-list.actionItem: 83 (Roll no. 125).
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on the question of agreeing to the amendments, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
On agreeing to the Yakym amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 166, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Yakym amendment No. 15.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Yakym,  numbered 15 printed in House Report 118-4 to require the statement estimating inflationary effects to break down the type of inflation to the CPI's major categories of Food, Energy, and All Items Less Food and Energy.

At the conclusion of debate on the Roy amendment No. 14, the Chair put the question on adoption of the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Raskin demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the amendment until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 166, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Roy amendment No. 14.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Roy,  numbered 14 printed in House Report 118-4 to strike exceptions to the mandatory inflation forecasting requirement.
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 166, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 13.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 13 printed in House Report 118-4 to require a detailed description of any impact on the consumer price index.
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 166, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 12.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 12 printed in House Report 118-4 to apply the bill's requirements to all major Executive Orders which cause an annual gross budgetary effect of at least $1 million.
On agreeing to the Omar amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 166, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Omar amendment No. 11.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Omar,  numbered 11 printed in House Report 118-4 to require supplementary Genuine Progress Indicator (GPI) factors be considered and evaluated when assessing applicable major executive orders.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 347 â€” "To require the Executive Office of the President to provide an inflation estimate with respect to Executive orders with a significant effect on the annual gross budget, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
